page.title: 07Three Corners Garage
page.content: Mr Smith told us that the road which leads to Arncott was not there when he came here,it was built in 1942\3 & his garage was built in 1950.It used to be a Shell station but is now a National station.He also owns Bicester Plant Hire employing 22 people & 11 at the garage.The petrol comes in lorries from Thame & he sells about 800gallons a day This year he sold 28 Renault cars.He has2 cars of his own & mends 9or10 cars a day.There are 10 cars for sale.When he bought the garage 35 years ago it didn't have a porch at the front & was very unmodern. (VICTORIA STUBBS). WORKING AT THE GARAGE. First you have to clock in then you get your overalls on,then you decide which job you're going to do.You have to service cars & mend broken cars.Then you go & test to make sure there is nothing wrong with them.You go home at 5pm. (J WOODHOUSE).
